record.dc:title: 63JO14, 15JO14, Johnson County, Kentucky. Mayo. Feature #39.
record.wpa:project_reservoir: Late Prehistoric Fort Ancient Sites in Kentucky
record.wpa:narrative: Refuse area. All of this area was heavily burned and contained many animal bones, shell, pottery and flint chips.Length 13.02 ft. EW.Width 8.70 ft. NS.Interior depth 0.50 ft. A large oval shaped fireplace containing many bones of bear, deer. A large number of sherds, flints were found in association with this bone. A few mussel shells were also found. Top of this feature had been disturbed by plow. All material from .5' level sacked as misc.
record.wpa:comments: More information, including diagram, available at institution.
